article.headline: Yale 77, Columbia 67
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Edwin Draughn scored 20 points and Caleb Holmes added 15, helping Yale snap a four-game losing streak with a 77-67 victory over Columbia on Friday night. Holmes scored nine points during a 16-4 run in the closing minutes of the first half that gave the Bulldogs (5-11, 1-2 Ivy League) a 42-34 lead at the break. Eric Flato had seven points during the spurt. Columbia (12-6, 3-2) was leading 28-26 when Holmes hit the first of his three 3-pointers to put Yale ahead to stay. Flato followed with two foul shots to make it 31-28. Matt Preston hit a jumper to make it 31-30 but Holmes hit two more 3s around another pair of free throws by Flato. Flato finished the run with a 3-pointer, putting Yale up 42-32. Yale's biggest lead was 62-48 with 5:04 to play. The Bulldogs were 24-of-33 from the free throw line, while Columbia made 10 of 13. Preston, who fouled out with 3:40 remaining, and Jeremiah Boswell, who scored nine points in the final 2:39, had 17 points each for Columbia. Dragutin Kravic finished with 14. Draughn and Holmes led five Bulldogs in double figures. Alex Gamboa and Flato scored 11 each and Sam Kaplan 10. In their third meeting, Yale coach James Jones took a 2-to-1 lead over his brother Joe who is now in his second season as Columbia's coach.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
